metadata.title: YouTube Analytics Dashboard 2025: Understanding Your Data
metadata.description: Master YouTube Analytics dashboard. Make data-driven content decisions.

hero.headline: YouTube Analytics Dashboard Guide
hero.subheadline: Understand your data. Make smarter content decisions.

sections.content: YouTube Analytics tells you exactly what's working and what isn't. The dashboard can seem overwhelming at first, but understanding the key sections helps you make informed decisions instead of guessing. Data-driven creators grow faster by doubling down on what works.

sections.title: Using Analytics Effectively
content: Study retention graphs for each video
Check traffic sources for reach insights

sections.title: Analytics Best Practices
content: Focus on trends, not daily fluctuations
Retention rate > view count for learning

faq.question: How often should I check analytics?
faq.answer: Weekly for strategic review. Daily checking creates anxiety without actionable insights. Data needs time to accumulate. Set specific review day/time. Resist urge to constantly refresh.

faq.question: What's the most important metric?
faq.answer: Depends on goals. Watch time for algorithm favor. CTR for thumbnail/title optimization. Retention for content quality. Revenue if monetized. Focus on one or two, not everything.

faq.question: Why do numbers differ from public view count?
faq.answer: Analytics updates differently than public counts. Some views filtered for spam/bots. Real-time tab shows immediate data. Overview shows verified data. Both are accurate for different purposes.

faq.question: How to export YouTube analytics?
faq.answer: Advanced mode in Analytics allows exports. Download as CSV or Google Sheets. Useful for deeper analysis or tracking over time. Compare to other data sources for full picture.
